author: @jimpauls7765
text: As always top-notch quality from Master Luke DataWalker :)  Quick question please! At 22:00, how exactly does the "previous_item" variable work properly?   When the condition initializes the item that matches the condition is (let's say) at position X in the list. How on science's green earth, we do retrieve the X - 1 position? (meaning with pull the sentence before our condition statement?)  I presume when the [for statement] takes takes effect the [item] is in X - 1 position (i.e. previous sentence), and it is only when the nested [if statement] takes effect that the [item] receives the position required by our condition?  Thank you!
